data.title: Default launch configuration for launching node in docker/docker-compose file
data.body:
# Feature request 

There is [this guide](https://alexanderzeitler.com/articles/debugging-a-nodejs-es6-application-in-a-docker-container-using-visual-studio-code/) on how to run your application in a docker image. This is great for testing in production-like environment. The downside is that you can only use the node `attach` request and you have to use nodemon with Legacy fs-watcher if you want to keep on working and not constantly want to manualy restart the docker image through the commandline.

It would be nice to have a `launch compose file` or `launch docker image` (with volume map as configuration options).

Possible configuration for running in docker image:
```
{
    "name": "Run in Docker",
    "type": "node",
    "request": "run-docker",
    "docker-image": "my-node:7.9.0-alpine",
    "prgram": "src/server.js",
    "localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}/",
    "remoteRoot": "/app",
     "mappings": {
         "/src/" : "/src/"
     }
}
```

data.title: Diff sometimes errors on unicode characters
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.11.2 - OS Version: macOS 10.12.4 Can't seem to stably reproduce the error, but it goes like this: 1. Open python file with unicode comments. 2. Do some changes. 3. Commit. 4. Edit file again (say, add a new line) 5. In Source Control tab the file contains not only the applied change, but another line, like: 6. `git diff` doesn't show that diff. On commit there is no such change in log.

data.title: Column breakpoints don't work with TypeScript sourcemaps
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write code like
```ts
[1, 2, 3].map(x => x * 2).filter(x => x > 3)
```
2. Try to set a column breakpoint in the arrow function

I don't know whether this is a problem with TS sourcemaps or the debugger, but it is very unfortunate

data.title: User Snippet cannot escape $
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|gc-excelviewer|GrapeCity|1.1.15|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|composer|ikappas|0.5.0|
|format-indent|Kasik96|1.3.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.6.0|
|cordova-tools|vsmobile|1.2.7|;


---

Call me crazy, but i am not able to escape $ character:

```
	"REIP": {
		"prefix": "REIP",
		"body": [
			"if ($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] == \"1234\") {",
			"    $0",
			"}"
		],
		"description": "if IP == my"
	}
```

Things I tried so far:

`"if (\$_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] == \"1234\") {",`
"Invalid escape character in string"

`"if ($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] == \"1234\") {",`
Not even shown +:
`"if ($$_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] == \"1234\") {",`
The cursor goes right between SERVER and ['REMOTE_ADDR'] (I don't want it there)

`"if (${1:$}_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] == \"1234\") {",`
It's a variable then and I also don't want the cursor there.


I don't know other legit ways to get around this .. any help?

data.title: Feature Request: Add line number when copying to word!!!
data.body:
Dear vscode developers,

I have tried the "copy to word feature" and all I can say is it was really beautiful, but I think it would be even better if you can add line number when copying.

Thank you for making such a great editor.

data.title: Expand docs on the side in the suggest widget
data.body:
First draft for #18582

Features in the PR:
- If either `suggestion.details` or `suggestion.documentation` exist, they will appear on the side of the suggest list. If no docs but details match then label, then the docs section is not shown
- To use page up and down in the docs, press `ctrl+space` and then page up and down as usual
-  A logic based on cursor position and viewport length is in place to decide when to swap the list and the docs. Not fool proof yet. Just a starting point

Pending:
- [x] More testing on corner scenarios where the list and docs need to be swapped
- [x] Show docs below when editor window is too small
- [ ] A visual cue for when focus is on the docs section vs the list
- [ ] Test accessibility and screen reader

Update as of 5/7: Logic to decide when to swap list and docs, where to position the suggest widget and when to re-size the docs is finalized here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/ramyar/docs-on-the-side/src/vs/editor/contrib/suggest/browser/suggestWidget.ts#L817

- OS Version: Windows 10 15063+

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add // @ts-check within HTML <script> tag with a tsconfig.json that works for JS files

Expected: Type check on HTML inline JavaScript

Actual: Same Salsa behavior, still autocompletes but no type check

data.title: Fix a potential hang when tsserver exits improperly
data.body:
**Bug**
If the TSServer restarts with ongoing requests queued, the new server instance may not properly startup. in the logs, this looks like a series of cancelled request followed by a restart message, and then more cancelled requests of the same series

**fix**
I believe the root cause of this is that the request queue is not properly flushed and the request sequence numbers are not properly reset when starting the new server instance.

Fixes #25807

data.title: TSServer Can Hang When Restarting With Ongoing Requests
data.body:
**Bug**
If the TSServer restarts with ongoing requests queued, the new server instance may not properly startup. In the trace, this looks like a series of cancelled request followed by a restart message, and then more cancelled requests of the same series

data.title: Add Suggestion Provider For TS Directives
data.body:
Adds a new completion provider to suggest typescript comment directives, such as `@ts-check` or `@ts-ignore`

Fixes #25413

data.title: workspace.openTextDocument opens second editor window
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12 insiders
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a text file in one split window pane
2. Focus another text file in the other spilt window pane
3. Run an extension command `workspace.openTextDocument` with URI from file from step 1

Expected: Focus is returned to existing open file from step 1

Actual: A new editor instance is opened in the split window pane from step 2.  Net results is two editor windows open with same URI.  One editor in each of the split pane windows.  This is a change in the openTextDocument behavior in the insiders build.


Additional note:  This is impacting the mssql for VS Code extension which has a link in the query results window that refocuses to the correct lines in the SQL file.  Instead of refocusing to the existing SQL editor, now a new editor window is opened.

data.title: Neo keyboard 4'th layer backspace not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - OSS 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-05-02T20:44:27.820Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.11-1-ARCH
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. use neo layout:
    $ setxkbmap de neo
2. Fresh install vscode:
    $ yaourt visual-studio-code-oss      //-git or the binary have the same problem
3. start vscode, open an new text file and type some text
4. press "ALT-GR + v" or "< + v" (should be backspace on 4'th layer) --> not working

- the normal backspace works.
- the arrow keys, DEL, ENTER and the other keys on the 4'th layer work as fine as everytime
- note: in the search dialog for the keyboard-shortcut-config, the 4'th layer backspace works
- I tried to delete all key-configs for keys related to "v" or "backspace" which changed nothing

For more information on Neo, see here: [http://neo-layout.org/](url)

data.title: IDE loops and memory leaks causes Linux to freeze
data.body:
Hello.

I was starting to write a small script with a swig library. Quickly, VSCode started to consume all memory and all swap memory until I had to reboot. I'm using VSCode 1.11.2 and OpenSuSE leap 42.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install quickfix-python
`$ sudo pip install quickfix`

2. start a project
3. type the script bellow.

```
#!/usr/bin/env python
import quickfix

class ClientApplication(quickfix.Application):
	def __init__(self, server):
		super(ClientApplication, self).__init__()
```

in my case, when I trigger autocompletion within the module quickfix, that is enough to cause the loop.

data.title: Edits lost because vscode reloads the file while editing it

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder from a network share served by samba on ubuntu 16.04
2. Work for some hours in vscode
3. Eventually the file you are working on will reload (without any file change from elsewhere) and you loose all your edits
That happens about 1 time in 2 hours.

data.title: Best way to run gulpfile.js in VSC?
data.body:
I am using latest version of VSC and wondering what is difference between running my gulpfile.js in the Task Runner or just running it in the integrated Terminal?  Both work and produce same results.  Is there any difference?

To run in Task Runner, I do not even create a tasks.json file any more.  I just go to the command Run Task and select the task name from my gulpfile.  It works great.

To run in Terminal, I just open and type "gulp" and it runs as it should.

Is the any difference or benefit to either method?

data.title: Closing script tags not colored not using ligatures
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (aa05dac84b7526550653a861c17b402349cb3bc6, 2017-05-02T00:04:13.700Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|ng-template|Angular|0.1.3|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.6.2|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.14.1|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.15.1|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|vscode-html-css|ecmel|0.1.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.2.3|
|vscode-icon-theme|jtlowe|1.5.0|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|11.1.0|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|vscode-autoprefixer|mrmlnc|2.0.0|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.3.0|
|angular2-inline|natewallace|0.0.17|
|typescript-hero|rbbit|0.12.0|
|project-snippets|rebornix|0.5.0|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.24.0|
|darcula-extended|smlombardi|3.3.2|
|slime|smlombardi|1.15.0|
|theme-tesla|smlombardi|6.0.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. in script tags, the opening angle bracket in closing `</script>` tags and no longer colored like other tag brackets:

![screen shot 2017-05-02 at 12 59 30 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/25629444/807b47e0-2f37-11e7-89ef-b517976bb54f.png)

for comparison, some non-script tags:

![screen shot 2017-05-02 at 1 02 00 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/25629476/98f0e4ba-2f37-11e7-9040-fbd153f2a87d.png)

Furthermore, you can see that this font, Fira Code, uses ligatures for the `</` yet the script tags no longer are using them.

Both things happened in the current build.

data.title: `list.activeSelectionBackground` seems to have no effect for custom themes when contrastBorder and contrastActiveBorder are set
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.12.0-insider (aa05dac84b7526550653a861c17b402349cb3bc6, 2017-05-02T00:04:13.700Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|nord-visual-studio-code|arcticicestudio|0.1.1|
|vetur|octref|0.6.4|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.6.0|
|vim|vscodevim|0.6.20|;


---

`list.activeSelectionBackground` seems to have no effect, no matter in `workbench.colorCustomizations` or in theme.

With Nord theme, I set `list.activeSelectionBackground: "#ffffff"` in `workbench.colorCustomizations` but the File Explorer is not showing highlight for active file:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/25627896/2bb885c4-2f32-11e7-80b4-5e2acedbe753.png)

Same problem for Nord, which has
`"list.activeSelectionBackground": "#3b4252"` but has no effect:

See https://github.com/arcticicestudio/nord-visual-studio-code/pull/11#issuecomment-298668994 for details.

@bpasero
